title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@rstudio.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

what: Raw System Credential Store Access from R
title: Raw System Credential Store Access from R
text: Raw System Credential Store Access R

title: Raw System Credential Store Access from R
text: Windows macOS support. Read, write, list search system credential store. Generic credentials, domain passwords, domain certificates Windows. Generic passwords internet passwords macOS. Multiple keychains macOS.

title: Raw System Credential Store Access from R
text: keyring R package provides portable system keyring API platforms, also supports multiple backends: https://github.com/r-lib/keyring

title: Raw System Credential Store Access from R
text: Install package CRAN:

title: Raw System Credential Store Access from R
text: oskeyring functions portable, work one operating system (OS). functions use system credential store can used OSes. E.g. macos_item() windows_item() portable. Calling function wrong OS throw oskeyring_bad_os_error error. oskeyring follows API OS closely, different set functions Windows macOS. E.g. macOS API can search keychain items based item attributes, similar API Windows, oskeyring windows_item_search() function.

title: Raw System Credential Store Access from R
text: oskeyring uses API defined wincred.h Windows. Windows credential store contains various credential types. ones supported oskeyring : windows_item_write() adds updates credential credential store. takes objects created windows_item() : windows_item_read() reads credential credential store, return value includes secret well: windows_item_enumerate() lists credentials match prefix. windows_item_delete() deletes credential. See manual: ?windows_credentials.
code: windows_item_types() #> [1] "generic"                 "domain_password"         #> [3] "domain_certificate"      "domain_visible_password" it <- windows_item("secret", "my-host-password") it #> <oskeyring_windows_item: generic> #>  target_name: my-host-password #>  persist: local_machine #>  credential_blob: <-- hidden --> windows_item_write(it) windows_item_read("my-host-password") #> <oskeyring_windows_item: generic> #>  target_name: my-host-password #>  persist: local_machine #>  credential_blob: <-- hidden -->

title: Raw System Credential Store Access from R
text: oskeyring uses Keychain API macOS. macOS keychains can store various classes items. item classes supported oskeyring : macos_item_add() adds new item keychain. takes objects created macos_item(): Items contain secret , set attributes, depends item class. See ?macos_keychain list attributes class. macos_item_search() searches keychain item: return secret , unless called return_data = TRUE. possibly prompts user password. macos_item_update() updates attributes existing Keychain items. macos_item_delete() deletes one Keychain items.
code: macos_item_classes() #> [1] "generic_password"  "internet_password" it <- macos_item(   "secret",   list(service = "My service", account = "Gabor"),   class = "generic_password" ) it #> <oskeyring_macos_item: generic_password> #>  account: Gabor #>  service: My service #>  value: <-- hidden --> macos_item_add(it) macos_item_search(attributes = list(service = "My service")) #> [[1]] #> <oskeyring_macos_item: generic_password> #>  account: Gabor #>  creation_date: 2020-10-21 10:01:44 #>  label: My service #>  modification_date: 2020-10-21 10:01:44 #>  service: My service

title: Raw System Credential Store Access from R
text: macOS supports multiple keychains. always default keychain, oskeyring uses default well. also keychain search list, secrets looked default, can contain multiple keychains. macos_item_*() functions keychain argument direct restrict operation specific keychain. macos_keychain_create() creates new keychain. macos_keychain_list() lists keychains search list. See macOS keychains manual: ?macos_keychain.

title: Raw System Credential Store Access from R
text: Please note oskeyring project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Raw System Credential Store Access from R

what: Query and manipulate the macOS Keychain — macos_keychain
title: Query and manipulate the macOS Keychain — macos_keychain
text: macos_item_* functions add, delete, update search Keychain items. macos_keychain_* functions create, delete, list, lock, unlock keychains. macos_item_classes() lists supported Keychain item classes. macos_item_attr() lists supported attributes classes. macos_item_match_options() lists options supported match argument macos_item_search().

title: Query and manipulate the macOS Keychain — macos_keychain
code: macos_item_classes()  macos_item(value, attributes = list(), class = "generic_password")  macos_item_add(item, keychain = NULL)  macos_item_search(   class = "generic_password",   attributes = list(),   match = list(),   return_data = FALSE,   keychain = NULL )  macos_item_update(   class = "generic_password",   attributes = list(),   match = list(),   update = list(),   keychain = NULL )  macos_item_delete(   class = "generic_password",   attributes = list(),   match = list(),   keychain = NULL )  macos_keychain_create(keychain, password = NULL)  macos_keychain_list(domain = c("all", "user", "system", "common", "dynamic"))  macos_keychain_delete(keychain)  macos_keychain_lock(keychain = NULL)  macos_keychain_unlock(keychain = NULL, password = NULL)  macos_keychain_is_locked(keychain = NULL)  macos_item_attr()  macos_item_match_options()

title: Query and manipulate the macOS Keychain — macos_keychain
text: value Value item, password, key certificate. must raw vector string. string, converted UTF-8. attributes Narrow search indicating attributes found item items . class Type items search, see macos_item_classes() possible values. item Keychain item, creted via macos_item() returned oskeyking . keychain Keychain use. NULL means default one. match Condition search variety ways. example, can limit results specific number items, control case sensitivity matching string attributes, etc. See 'Search parameters' . return_data Whether include secret data search result. set TRUE, set limit parameter (match argument) finite value. TRUE, macOS prompt passwords necessary. might get multiple password prompts, set limit larger one value. update Named list specifying new values attributes. password Password unlock keychain, new password set creating new keychain. May NULL interactive sessions, force secure password dialog. domain preference domain wish retrieve keychain search list: "": include keychains currently search list, "user": user preference domain, "system": system daemon preference domain, "common": keychains common everyone, "dynamic": dynamic search list (typically provided removable keychains smart cards).

title: Query and manipulate the macOS Keychain — macos_keychain
text: macos_item_classes() returns character vector, names supported keychain item classes. macos_item() returns new oskeyring_macos_item object. macos_item_add() returns NULL, invisibly. macos_item_search() returns list keychain items. macos_item_update() returns NULL, invisibly. macos_item_delete() returns NULL, invisibly. macos_keychain_create() returns NULL, invisibly. macos_keychain_list() returns data frame columns: path: Path file keychain. is_locked: Whether keychain locked. is_readable: Whether keychain readable user. is_writeable: Whether keychain writeable user. macos_keychain_delete() returns NULL, invisibly. macos_keychain_lock() returns NULL, invisibly. macos_keychain_unlock() returns NULL, invisibly. macos_keychain_is_locked() returns TRUE FALSE. macos_item_attr() returns list lists character scalars, description keychain item attributes, keychain item class. macos_item_match_options() returns list character scalars, description supported match options.

title: Query and manipulate the macOS Keychain — macos_keychain
text: macos_item_classes() returns currently supported Keychain item classes.   macos_item() creates new Keychain item. See next section attributes supported various item types.   macos_item_add() adds item keychain. already item primary keys, error.   macos_item_search() searches Keychain items. return_data TRUE also returns secret data. Returning secret data might create password entry dialog. return_data TRUE need set limit match condition (small) finite number.   macos_item_update() updates existing Keychain items.   macos_item_delete() deletes one Keychain items. Note matching items deleted.
code: macos_item_classes() #> [1] "generic_password"  "internet_password" it <- macos_item("secret", list(service = "My service", account = "Gabor")) it #> <oskeyring_macos_item: generic_password> #>  account: Gabor #>  service: My service #>  value: <-- hidden --> macos_item_add(it) macos_item_search(attributes = list(service = "My service")) #> [[1]] #> <oskeyring_macos_item: generic_password> #>  account: Gabor #>  creation_date: 2022-09-08 11:04:52 #>  label: My service #>  modification_date: 2022-09-08 11:04:52 #>  service: My service macos_item_update(   attributes = list(service = "My service", account = "Gabor"),   update = list(account = "Gabor Csardi") ) macos_item_search(attributes = list(service = "My service")) #> [[1]] #> <oskeyring_macos_item: generic_password> #>  account: Gabor Csardi #>  creation_date: 2022-09-08 11:04:52 #>  label: My service #>  modification_date: 2022-09-08 11:04:52 #>  service: My service macos_item_delete(attributes = list(service = "My service")) macos_item_search(attributes = list(service = "My service")) #> list()

title: Query and manipulate the macOS Keychain — macos_keychain
text: set supported attributes depends class item. oskeyring supports following item classes currently: generic_password, internet_password. subset attributes form primary key. possible add one item primary key. See primary keys various classes . oskeyring currently support attributes Keychain Services AIP supports. attributes read-. try set adding updating items, ignored. attribute included return value macos_item_search() set, default value effect.

title: Query and manipulate the macOS Keychain — macos_keychain
text: creation_date: [.POSIXct(1)][read-] date item created. modification_date: [.POSIXct(1)][read-] last time item updated. description: [character(1)] User-visible string describing kind ofitem (example, 'Disk image password'). comment: [character(1)] User-editable comment item. label: [character(1)] User-visible label item. is_invisible: [logical(1)] TRUE item invisible (, displayed). is_negative: [logical(1)] Indicates whether valid password associated keychain item. useful application want password particular service stored keychain, prefers always entered user. account: [character(1)][key] Account name. service: [character(1)][key] service associated item. generic: [character(1)] User-defined attribute. synchronizable: [logical(1)] Indicates whether item question synchronized devices iCloud.

title: Query and manipulate the macOS Keychain — macos_keychain
text: creation_date: [.POSIXct(1)][read-] date item created. modification_date: [.POSIXct(1)][read-] last time item updated. description: [character(1)] User-visible string describing kind ofitem (example, 'Disk image password'). comment: [character(1)] User-editable comment item. label: [character(1)] User-visible label item. is_invisible: [logical(1)] TRUE item invisible (, displayed). is_negative: [logical(1)] Indicates whether valid password associated keychain item. useful application want password particular service stored keychain, prefers always entered user. account: [character(1)][key] Account name. synchronizable: [logical(1)] Indicates whether item question synchronized devices iCloud. security_domain: [character(1)][key] item's security domain. server: [character(1)][key] Contains server's domain name IP address. protocol: [character(1)][key] protocol item. authentication_type: character[1][key] Authentication type. port: [integer(1)][key] Internet port number. path: [character(1)][key] path, typically path component URL

title: Query and manipulate the macOS Keychain — macos_keychain
text: osxkeychain supports limited set search parameters. can provide macos_item_search() match argument: limit: [numeric(1)] value specifies maximum number results return otherwise act upon. Use Inf specify matching items.

title: Query and manipulate the macOS Keychain — macos_keychain
text: macOs supports multiple keychains. always default keychain, user's login keychain, unless configured differently. also keychain search list. Keychains may belong four non-exclusive categories, see domain argument macos_keychain_list(). keychain stored encrypted file disk, see first column output macos_keychain_list(). macos_item_*() functions keychain argument direct restrict operation single keychain . defaults: macos_item_add() adds item default keychain. macos_item_search() searches keychains search list. macos_item_update() updates matching items keychains search list. macos_item_delete() deletes matching items keychains search list. macos_keychain_create() creates new keychain. macos_keychain_list() lists keychains search list.     macos_keychain_lock() locks keychain. macos_keychain_unlock() unlocks keychain. macos_keychain_is_locked() checks keychain locked.         macos_keychain_delete() deletes keychain: removes search list deletes data disk. currently refuses delete user's login keychain system keychain. Use Keychain Access instead want delete . (aware bad consequences.)
code: new <- "~/Library/Keychains/test.keychain-db" macos_keychain_create(new, password = "secret") macos_keychain_list() ##                                                     path is_unlocked ## 1 /Users/gaborcsardi/Library/Keychains/login.keychain-db        TRUE ## 2 /Users/gaborcsardi/Library/Keychains/shiny.keychain-db       FALSE ## 3  /Users/gaborcsardi/Library/Keychains/test.keychain-db        TRUE ## 4                     /Library/Keychains/System.keychain       FALSE ##   is_readable is_writeable ## 1        TRUE         TRUE ## 2        TRUE        FALSE ## 3        TRUE         TRUE ## 4        TRUE        FALSE macos_keychain_lock(new) macos_keychain_is_locked(new) ## [1] TRUE macos_keychain_unlock(new, password = "secret") macos_keychain_is_locked(new) ## [1] FALSE macos_keychain_delete(new) macos_keychain_list() ##                                                     path is_unlocked ## 1 /Users/gaborcsardi/Library/Keychains/login.keychain-db        TRUE ## 2 /Users/gaborcsardi/Library/Keychains/shiny.keychain-db       FALSE ## 3                     /Library/Keychains/System.keychain       FALSE ##   is_readable is_writeable ## 1        TRUE         TRUE ## 2        TRUE        FALSE ## 3        TRUE        FALSE

title: Query and manipulate the macOS Keychain — macos_keychain

what: oskeyring: Raw System Credential Store Access from R — oskeyring-package
title: oskeyring: Raw System Credential Store Access from R — oskeyring-package
text: Aims support features system credential store, including non-portable ones. Supports 'Keychain' 'macOS', 'Credential Manager' 'Windows'. See 'keyring' package need portable 'API'.

title: oskeyring: Raw System Credential Store Access from R — oskeyring-package
text: Maintainer: Gábor Csárdi csardi.gabor@gmail.com contributors: RStudio [copyright holder, funder]

what: Query and manipulate the Windows Credential Store — windows_credentials
title: Query and manipulate the Windows Credential Store — windows_credentials
text: windows_item_* functions read, write, delete list credentials.

title: Query and manipulate the Windows Credential Store — windows_credentials
code: windows_item_types()  windows_item(   credential_blob,   target_name,   type = "generic",   comment = NULL,   persist = c("local_machine", "session", "enterprise"),   attributes = list(),   target_alias = NULL,   username = NULL )  windows_item_read(target_name, type = "generic")  windows_item_write(item, preserve = FALSE)  windows_item_delete(target_name, type = "generic")  windows_item_enumerate(filter = NULL, all = FALSE)

title: Query and manipulate the Windows Credential Store — windows_credentials
text: credential_blob secret credential, password, certificate key. See also https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/wincred/ns-wincred-credentialw can raw vector, string. string, converted Unicode, without terminating zero. can also NULL, used preserve = TRUE argument windows_item_write(). target_name name credential. target_name type members uniquely identify credential. member changed credential created. Instead, credential old name deleted credential new name created. member longer CRED_MAX_GENERIC_TARGET_NAME_LENGTH (32767) characters. member case-insensitive. type type credential. member changed credential created. See windows_item_types() possible values. comment NULL, string comment user describes credential. member longer CRED_MAX_STRING_LENGTH (256) characters. stored Unicode string. persist Defines persistence credential. "local_machine": credential persists subsequent logon sessions computer. visible logon sessions user computer visible logon sessions user computers. "session": credential persists life logon session. visible logon sessions user. exist user logs back . "enterprise": credential persists subsequent logon sessions computer. visible logon sessions user computer logon sessions user computers. attributes Application-defined attributes associated credential. NULL named list raw string vectors. String vectors converted Unicode, without terminating zero. credential can 64 attributes, names attributes longer CRED_MAX_STRING_LENGTH (256) characters , attributes longer CRED_MAX_VALUE_SIZE (256) bytes. target_alias Alias target_name member. member can read written. longer CRED_MAX_STRING_LENGTH (256) characters. stored Unicode. username NULL user name account used connect target_name. item oskeyring_windows_item object write. preserve credential BLOB existing credential preserved credential name credential type. credential_blob passed oskeyring_windows_item object must NULL. filter NULL, string filter credentials. credentials target_name matching filter returned. filter specifies name prefix followed asterisk. instance, filter "FRED*" return credentials target_name beginning string "FRED". Whether use CRED_ENUMERATE_ALL_CREDENTIALS flag enumerate credentials. TRUE, filter must NULL. TRUE, target name credential returned "namespace:attribute=target" format.

title: Query and manipulate the Windows Credential Store — windows_credentials
text: windows_item_types() returns character vector, currently supported credential types. windows_item() returns oskeyring_windows_item object. windows_item_read() returns oskeyring_windows_item object. windows_item_write() returns NULL, invisibly. windows_item_delete() returns NULL, invisibly. windows_item_enumerate() returns list oskeyring_windows_item items.

title: Query and manipulate the Windows Credential Store — windows_credentials
text: windows_item_types() lists currently supported credential types.

title: Query and manipulate the Windows Credential Store — windows_credentials
text: windows_item() creates Windows credential, can added credential store.
code: it <- windows_item("secret", "my-host-password") it #> <oskeyring_windows_item: generic> #>  target_name: my-host-password #>  persist: local_machine #>  credential_blob: <-- hidden -->

title: Query and manipulate the Windows Credential Store — windows_credentials
text: Writes item credential store.

title: Query and manipulate the Windows Credential Store — windows_credentials
text: Reads credential specified type target_name.

oskeyring 0.1.4
text: CRAN release: 2022-09-08 user visible changes.

title: oskeyring 0.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2022-03-11 version fixes potential crash macOS (#11).

title: oskeyring 0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2021-11-20 Windows functions now use UTF-16 (little endian) encoding instead UCS-2. UTF-16 default reasonably recent Windows versions.

title: oskeyring 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2020-11-09 windows_item_enumerate() now occasionally crash.

title: oskeyring 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-10-30 First public release.
